str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To eat up, eat till it is finished, devour, squander, annoy, injure. From kata and esthio; to eat down, i.e. Devour.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary word; life, i.e. the present state of existence; by implication, the means of livelihood.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
A prostitute; met: an idolatrous community. Feminine of pornos; a strumpet; figuratively, an idolater.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; properly, to rush, i.e. to sacrifice; by extension to immolate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fattened, fatted. From a derivative of sitos; grain-fed, i.e. Fattened.
A calf, heifer, young bull. Probably strengthened for oschos; a young bullock.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
